content: Abijah Succeeds Rehoboam
In the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam, Abijah became king over Judah.
He reigned in Jerusalem for three years; and his mother’s name was Micaiah the daughter of Uriel of Gibeah.Now there was war between Abijah and Jeroboam.
Abijah began the battle with an army of warriors, four hundred thousand chosen men, while Jeroboam drew up in battle formation against him with eight hundred thousand chosen men  valiant warriors.
Civil War
Then Abijah stood on Mount Zemaraim, which is in the hill country of Ephraim, and said, “Listen to me, Jeroboam and all Israel:
Do you not know that the  God of Israel gave the rule over Israel forever to David and his sons by a covenant of salt?
Yet Jeroboam the son of Nebat, the servant of Solomon the son of David, rose up and rebelled against his master,
and worthless men gathered to him, wicked men, who proved too strong for Rehoboam, the son of Solomon, when he was young and timid and could not hold his own against them.
“So now you intend to assert yourselves against the kingdom of the  through the sons of David, being a great multitude and  with you the golden calves which Jeroboam made for you as gods.

Have you not driven out the priests of the , the sons of Aaron and the Levites, and made for yourselves priests like the peoples of  lands? Whoever comes to consecrate himself with a bull and seven rams, even he may become a priest of  not gods.
But as for us, the  is our God, and we have not abandoned Him; and the sons of Aaron are ministering to the  as priests, and the Levites attend to their work.

Every morning and evening they burn to the  burnt offerings and fragrant incense, and the showbread is  on the clean table, and the golden lampstand with its lamps is  to light every evening; for we perform  duty to the  our God, but you have abandoned Him.

Now behold, God is with us at  head, and His priests with the signal trumpets to sound the war cry against you. Sons of Israel, do not fight against the  God of your fathers, for you will not succeed.”
But Jeroboam had set an ambush to come from behind, so that  was in front of Judah and the ambush was behind them.
When Judah turned around, behold, they were attacked both from front and rear; so they cried out to the , and the priests blew the trumpets.
Then the men of Judah raised a war cry, and when the men of Judah raised the war cry, God defeated Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah.
When the sons of Israel fled from Judah, God handed them over to them.
Abijah and his people defeated them with a great slaughter, so that five hundred thousand chosen men of Israel fell slain.
The sons of Israel were subdued at that time, and the sons of Judah conquered because they trusted in the , the God of their fathers.
Abijah pursued Jeroboam and captured from him  cities, Bethel with its villages, Jeshanah with its villages, and Ephron with its villages.
Death of Jeroboam
Jeroboam did not again recover strength in the days of Abijah; and the  struck him and he died.
But Abijah became powerful, and he took fourteen wives for himself, and fathered twenty-two sons and sixteen daughters.
Now the rest of the acts of Abijah, and his ways and his words are written in the treatise of Iddo the prophet.
